url.title: Six Essential Tips for Async
url.description: Async involves some new concepts. They're not difficult; just unfamiliar. Over the past year Lucian Wischik has been watching how people use Async in C# and VB. This series distils out the six essenti&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Six Essential Tips For Async - Introduction
video:video.video:description: Async involves some new concepts. They're not difficult; just unfamiliar. Over the past year Lucian Wischik has been watching how people use async/await in C# and VB. This series distils out the three&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Tip 1: Async void is for top-level event-handlers only
video:video.video:description: Async Tip #1: Async void is for top-level event-handlers only, and event-like things. Don't use it elsewhere in your code. Slides are available on Lucian's blog. Async void is a &quot;fire-and-forget&&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Tip 2: Distinguish CPU-Bound work from IO-bound work
video:video.video:description: Async Tip #2: It's crucial to distinguish CPU-bound work (should be done on threadpool) from IO-bound work (which needn't). You can download slides for this talk from Lucian's blog. I remember reading&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Tip 3: Wrap events up in Task-returning APIs and await them
video:video.video:description: Async Tip #3: You can wrap events up in Task-returning APIs and await them. This can dramatically simplify code. Slides and source code are available on Lucian's blog. This video introduces a new patt&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Tip 4: Async Library Methods Shouldn't Lie
video:video.video:description: Libraries shouldn't lie. That's not why they're called &quot;lie-braries&quot;... The threadpool is an app-global resource, so you should leave the callers of your library to decide how and when they &#8230;

video:video.video:title: Tip 5: Async libraries APIs should be chunky
video:video.video:description: 5. Libraries should have chunky async APIs. But if you can't achieve that, there's a micro-optimization you can use for async methods based around the fast-path which can reduce or eliminate the heap &#8230;

video:video.video:title: Tip 6: Async library methods should consider using Task.ConfigureAwait(false)
video:video.video:description: 6. Libraries should consider Task.ConfigureAwait(false). This is another micro-optimization you can use to reduce your methods' impact on the UI thread. Consider this if your library routine might be &#8230;
